ngiemboon: Ngùʼ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a ge láʼ gwɔ́ tà gwaa cʉ́me, pi véle menjǔ pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin mmó gí.
en: “At the end of every seven years you must cancel debts.

ngiemboon: Pi júʼ páʼ pi ge láʼ gÿo púʼu tá lɔg véle: yɛ̌ ngùʼ levelé njǔ, á na lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, lɔɔn ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńtó, mbà wɛ̌ nyìŋ Ésàlayɛ wɔ́ɔ gẅie fɛ̌ we ka tǒ fu nkáb mbwó yé, à te gíŋe kʉ́a yɛ̌ njǔ wɔ́. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ Ésàlayɛ ké le sẅɛ́ɛ fɛ̌ we ngie à toŋ njǔ ye wɔ́.
en: This is how to cancel debt: Every creditor   is to cancel what he has lent his neighbor. He is not to collect anything from his neighbor or brother, because the Lord’s release of debts has been proclaimed.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na ngʉ̀, mbà ngwɔ́ pi sẅɛ́ɛ yé ngie à toŋ njǔ ye. Tá ńké ńgʉa na fɛ̌ gẅi, mbà pi gẅiin lévéle njǔ ye.
en: You may collect something from a foreigner, but you must forgive whatever your brother owes you.

ngiemboon: Ambóŋ zɔɔn te gẅiin légwɔ́ nùɔ pi wɔ́; ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, e Ssé gi, ge gÿo néŋ mbʉ́lè na pi, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie à náa né pi páʼ tÿɔgɔ́ légwɔ́ gie pi zyɛ́ʼ ńkú.
en: “There will be no poor among you, however, because the Lord is certain to bless you in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess as an inheritance    #— #

ngiemboon: Táʼ, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pi júʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, e Ssé gi, ḿbiŋ ńgiŋ páʼ membʉ̌ mie n zǎb lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn ńtí gẅí, é ne ńzɛ́te.
en: if only you obey the Lord your God and are careful to follow every one of these commands I am giving you today.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ge gÿo néŋ mbʉ́lè na pi páʼ à la gɔɔn. Pi ge fu menkáb mí, á mbwó meláʼ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, táʼ, ńgʉa na pi, mbà pi te zága mmó tà gẅiin léfu nkáb wɔ́. Pi ge gÿo gwɔ́ metáfàʼ pʉ̀a mengwòŋ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Táʼ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ le gwɔ́ táfàʼ gẅi wɔ́.
en: When the Lord your God blesses you as he has promised you, you will lend to many nations but not borrow; you will rule many nations, but they will not rule you.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ fɛ̌ gẅi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńgwɔ́ mbóŋ, ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ tàʼ na metÿǒsoŋ mí, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, náa né pi, mbà á té ne ńzɛ́te ngie pi gwɔ́ pate gaba pwó, ńdʉʼʉ lékẅéte yé wɔ́.
en: “If there is a poor person among you, one of your brothers within any of your city gates in the land the Lord your God is giving you, do not be hardhearted or tightfisted toward your poor brother.

ngiemboon: Pi ge lɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m, éfuu yé mmó gie á ne ńzága mbwó yé.
en: Instead, you are to open your hand to him and freely loan him enough for whatever need he has.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn! Ndyɛ̀ʼ pi gẅiin nkwaŋá tepòŋ, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ngùʼ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a cʉ́ʼʉ ńtóo tǒ, ńgwɔ́ ngùʼ gie peg véle menjǔ.» Pi pɔ́ɔn légẅiin yɛ̌ ntí nkwaŋá, ńdíe fɛ̌ gẅi gẅie aa mbóŋ ńŋwɔ́ʼte yé, tà ńdʉʼʉ lénáa mmó né yé. Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, mbà à ge púte gẅí á mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, pi gwe ntsaŋ.
en: Be careful that there isn’t this wicked thought in your heart, ‘The seventh year, the year of canceling debts, is near,’ and you are stingy toward your poor brother and give him nothing. He will cry out to the Lord against you, and you will be guilty.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m gí, ńná té mʉ́ʼte. À cʉa púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à néŋ mbʉ́lè na mefàʼ mí ntsèm, tà mbɔɔ na mejʉʼʉ fàʼ mí ntsèm.
en: Give to him, and don’t have a stingy heart   when you give, and because of this the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in everything you do.  # 15:10 Lit you put your hand to

ngiemboon: Mepóŋ těen ńdáʼa ńzága tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ wɔ́. Áa mmó gie á gÿo, n tsẅii yɔɔn nò né pi ngie: Pi gẅiin légaba pwó, ńkẅéte fɛ̌ gẅi gẅie aa fÿàg kà pɔ́ gẅie aa mbóŋ wɔ́ɔ, gẅie aa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅí.
en: For there will never cease to be poor people in the land;   that is why I am commanding you, ‘Open your hand willingly to your poor and needy brother in your land.’

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ fɛ̌ gẅi nyìŋ Ébɛ̀, á wembàŋa kà wemanzwě wɔ́ɔ, lɔɔn ńtó ésẅiŋ mbùm ye, á mbwó pi, mbà à ge faʼa mbwó pi na mengùʼ ntɔgɔ́ páʼ nkwɔɔn. Táʼ, mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a gwɔ́ tà ńtó, pi nyé yé, à cʉ́ʼʉ ndùnnɛ́, ḿbiŋ né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: “If your fellow Hebrew, a man or woman, is sold to you and serves you six years, you must set him free in the seventh year.

ngiemboon: À ge gwaa piŋ púʼu, pi ké le nyé yé, á piŋ mbwó mesẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́;
en: When you set him free, do not send him away empty-handed.

ngiemboon: pi ge gʉa na shúm sie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à něŋ mbʉ́lè na pi, ńnáa mbwó pi, é menjʉ̀njÿò mí lâ mvfó gí, é ngesáŋ ntsíŋ gi gie e fǒ jʉʼʉ lesaŋá shúm, mbɔɔ melùʼ mí mie é fǒ jʉʼʉ lekyěen melùʼ, é kẅile shúm nanǎ, é ná né yé.
en: Give generously to him from your flock, your threshing floor, and your winepress. You are to give him whatever the Lord your God has blessed you with.

ngiemboon: Pi ge kímte páʼ pi la gíŋ ńgwɔ́ gí ngwòŋ Egíbtò, ńgwɔ́ menkwɔɔn, tá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, á fó wó ńkẅile gẅí, áa mmó gie á gÿǒ tá mèŋ n tÿɔ́g sɔɔn lepʉ̌ á mbwó pi lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed   you; that is why I am giving you this command today.  # 15:15 Dt 24:18,22

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńgwɔ́ gie nkwɔɔn jù lɔɔn ńgɔɔn né gù ngie: «N te ne ńkwoŋo léfó mbʉ̀a gù ńgʉa wɔ́.» Ńtí nue à kwoŋo gẅí lâ tsìŋendá gí, ḿbiŋ ne ńjúʼu mboŋó, á mbʉ̀a pi,
en: But if your slave says to you, ‘I don’t want to leave you,’ because he loves you and your family, and is well off with you,

ngiemboon: mbà pi ge péle letuŋó sé na kʉ̀ŋe ndá, é pí mbùʼ gie é sẅité, é lɔg tɔ́g, à fó mǒ, ńdáʼa ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nkwɔɔn gi. Pi ge gíŋe gʉa na nkwɔɔn gi yemanzwě, é gÿo pɔ́ púʼu.
en: take an awl and pierce through his ear into the door, and he will become your slave for life. Also treat your female slave the same way.

ngiemboon: Tà pi mÿɔgɔ lényé nkwɔɔn, é cʉ́ʼ ndùnnɛ́, é fó mbʉ̀a pi ńgʉa, ńtí nue e faʼá mbwó pi ngùʼ ntɔgɔ́, afàʼ gie à pǐŋ faʼa mbwó pi, á gwɔ́ ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a á na ye nyìŋ gẅie mé ne ḿbéen yé; à cʉa púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, néŋ mbʉ́lè na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi ge gÿo.
en: Do not regard it as a hardship   when you set him free, because he worked for you six years #— #worth twice the wages of a hired worker. Then the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.  # 15:12–18 Ex 21:2–11

ngiemboon: Epúɔ letwó menɔ̀ɔn pí pie é kẅɛ̌ melúm, é pe mefòŋ, é pe menjʉ̀njÿò lâ pe mvfó, é ge gÿo gwɔ́ me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ɔ̀ te lɔg púɔ letwó mefòŋ pú, é lɔg faʼa tsɔ́ fàʼ wó, é ké le kwóon menoŋ na púɔ letwó menjʉ̀njÿò lâ pe mvfó, é pie ée melúm wɔ́.
en: “Consecrate to the Lord your God every firstborn male produced by your herd and flock.   You are not to put the firstborn of your oxen to work or shear the firstborn of your flock.

ngiemboon: Pi lâ tsìŋendá gí ge néŋe, é pfɛ́ɛ wɔ́b mengùʼ ntsèm, á jʉʼʉ ndʉalʉ̌a gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à la záb.
en: Each year you and your family are to eat it before the Lord your God in the place the Lord chooses.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn lɔɔn ńgẅiin tsɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ kà á gwɔ̌ pɔ́ pwɔʼɔ kwò wɔ́ɔ, kà pɔ́ fʉ̀menÿɔ́g wɔ́ɔ, kà ńgẅiin pɔ́ tsɔ́ ntʉ̀ lɔ̌ʼ wɔ́ɔ, mbà ngwɔ́ pi le lɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ á mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi wɔ́.
en: But if there is a defect in the animal, if it is lame or blind or has any serious defect, you may not sacrifice it to the Lord your God.

ngiemboon: Pi ge pfɛ́ páʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie áa tsẅénɔ̀ɔn kà pɔ́ métsẅè wɔ́ɔ. Ngwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin ncÿǒ, tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é té ncÿǒ gẅiin, é pfɛ́; pi ge pfɛ́ɛ púʼu, á tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mí.
en: Eat it within your city gates; both the unclean person and the clean may eat it, as though it were a gazelle or deer.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi pɔ́ɔn lépfɛ́ metse nɔ̀ɔn gẅie pi zẅě, pi ge gÿo, e pfɛte ssé páʼ ntse.
en: But you must not eat its blood; pour it on the ground like water.
